document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

Chilean distribution. From Coquimbo to Los Lagos region ( Fig. 70 ).
Altitudinal range. From coastal to precordillera ecosystems (5– 1,200 m .a.s.l.).

Biology and notes.
Macrometopia atra
is mainly associated with Mediterranean scrubland, Valdivian forests or Nothofagus forest although is it also likely to be found in open areas (R. Barahona-Segovia, pers. obs.). According to
Smith-Ramírez et al. (2005)
, this species visits flowers of the endemic trees
Eucryphia cordifolia
and
M. planipes
in Chiloé (R. Barahona-Segovia, obs. pers.).
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 123,128 km 2 , AOO = 116 km 2 , 25 subpopulations and 27 localities.
